Several examples including the ones of the Export-Import bank of India were discussed at the 8th session of the UNCTAD Trade Policy Dialogue: Trade Finance under Covid-19. The session of 18 January 2022 was jointly organized by UNCTAD, the UN DESA, and the Global Network of Export-Import Banks and Development Finance Institutions (G-NEXID). G-NEXID brings together 13 development finance institutions in developing countries with an aim to facilitate cooperation among member institutions in support of South-South trade, investment, and project finance

Statistical Performance Indicators (SPI)”
Data for Development Profiles: Official Development Assistance for Data and Statistical Systems
Non-profit organizations and universities Genuine Progress Indicator: measured by 26 indicators across economic, environmental and social categories.a
World Bank Wealth of Nations Report: measures a nation’s wealth by capturing renewable and non-renewable natural capital, produced capital, human capital and net foreign assets.b

European Commission, OECD, Club of Beyond GDP Initiative: aims to i) complement GDP with environmental and social indicators; ii) provide near real-time information Rome, European Parliament, World for decision-making; iii) ensure more accurate reporting on distribution and inequalities; iv) develop a European sustainable Wildlife Fund, European Commission development scoreboard; and v) extend national accounts to environmental and social issues.c

Bhutan Gross National Happiness Index: based on four pillars of sustainable and equitable socioeconomic development; environmental conservation; preservation and promotion of culture; and good governance.d The Government has used the index to guide policy

United Kingdom National Well-being Measures: produced by the Office for National Statistics, measures are organized into 10 areas – personal well-being, our relationships, health, where we live, what we do, personal finance, economy, education and skills, governance, and environment.f

United Nations Development Programme Human Development Index: summary measure of average achievement in three dimensions: a long and healthy life, being knowl-(UNDP) edgeable and having a decent standard of living.g
OECD Better Life Index: based on 11 areas – housing, income, jobs, community, education, environment, governance, health, life satisfaction, safety, and work-life balance.h
Sustainable Development Solutions World Happiness Report: based on life evaluations from the Gallup World Poll.i Network
Social Progress Imperative Social Progress Index: based on three dimensions – basic human needs, foundations of wellbeing, and opportunity.j

World Bank Human Capital Index: measures the human capital that a child born today can expect to attain by age 18, given the risks of poor health and poor education that prevail in the country where the child lives.k
